Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> @ch6ris That a given website can make API calls to different wallets is not indicative of them being of the same base.
CHIPS is a fork of Bitcoin
KMD is a fork of Zcash which is a fork of Bitcoin
"KMD BTC BCH DASH LTC HUSH" (and a thousand others) share the same ancestry, and therefore much of the same base API structure and many core parts/functions.
CHIPS is part of the ecosystem, but isn't part of komodod because of LN (or at least that's the shortest way to describe it)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> Hey guys, I have a question. @sg777 @jl777c @jorian Why did you create chips as a separate coin? Why didn't you just make poker and casino software that allows you to bet with Komodo? I don't understand the need for the coin.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jorian> KMD doesn't have lightning, CHIPS does

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jorian> james knows more about the specific reasons

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jl777c> I would never contaminate KMD codebase with segwit

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <crumb> is it just that KMD would not be "fast" (blocktime/confirmation time wise) enough or are there other specific technical reasons besides that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jl777c> segwit is an abomination, why to integrate it?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> Segwit/LN "works" for what it works for and __none__ of those cases are actual "average currency user" cases (no matter what you read on reddit), so putting it in something like Komodo would be pointless (even assuming all the other issues were worked out)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> But why not have deposits in komodo. Players play with chips that represent komodo and when they withdrawal they withdraw komodo. I don't see what the advantage is of chips compared to previous bitcoin poker sites and gambling sites. Also, a bigger poker/gambling site would be more respected with more credibility if it was attached to a bigger coin.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> But I am not technical

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> ` I don't see what the advantage is of chips compared to previous bitcoin poker sites and gambling sites.`
Because it's an entire gaming platform, not limited to just poker or "gambling".
The idea is to build a platform that nearly any game you can think of can be used on.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> Why cant bitcoin be used in any game u can think of?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> Because bitcoin doesn't have any rule sets for games or logic (aside from the currency stuff itself)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> That's what I mean, what's the difference between a currency being on a any game u can think of platform and chips being a currency on any game u can think of

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> Can you think of a currency that has a card shuffler in the consensus of the coin itself?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> No. I mean practically what is the difference for consumer or user?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> How is it better than any program on top of a crypto currency

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> CHIPS and the platform will not just be used as currency *in* the games, it will contain the consensus rules *for* the games

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> Sorry buddy, I'm not technical. What does that mean? How is it better?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie ãƒ„> Layer apps (on top of the currency) depend on you trusting the app/site to decide and enforce rules
With this idea, rules in the consensus code means that everyone shares the rules, and any time the rules are changed the majority of users must agree to those rules being changed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> Oh I see what u mean

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> So the community change the software together kind of thing.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> That's really interesting

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
` Why cant bitcoin be used in any game u can think of?`
Easy answer: Because blocktime of BTC is 10 minutes... i don't think you want to wait 10 minutes or more for a player of poker to place his bet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Vibr> Atomic swaps between LN enabled chains could be possible though, or some time locked contract where one could use any currency externally and chips would be used internally (both balances displayed)?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <crumb> hmm. now that i read my question it is clear that it was too vague. i did not mean why segwit is not used in KMD, but what technical reasons are there to use CHIPS instead of KMD or BTC for example. @cipi  and @ComputerGenie ãƒ„ already explained it, so i was right to assume that one of the reasons for using CHIPS is confirmation times and CHIPS being not just in-game currency, but part of the games platform itself?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <GlorymanRTS> I understand better now, thanks guys

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jl777c> LN has many issues, but for a hub and spoke topology it can indeed to very fast transactions, so technically it works for realtime poker. CHIPS is meant to be used via LN for all the games. LN requires segwit
